CatDescriptText: Harry Pinckney, Fifth Ward, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would ask him about the atomic bomb testing. I would say, 'Look, we're also capable of everything that you might think of doing.'  And I would ask him why can't he treat us, talk with us, in the same way that we've treated him in the past.  When he came to our country, we treated him royally."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harry Pinckney wearing light colored cap, plaid shirt, diamond patterned sweater, and dark zippered jacket with knitted collar, standing on sidewalk in front of parked cars and buildings
